bio.name: Niel Silanmiere
bio.highConcept: Dishonored assassin searching for a gateway to his past.
bio.flaw: I'm obsessed with an idea and I'll do whatever it takes to see it become a reality, even if it means the well-being of others.
bio.description: Taller than average. Extremely lean and not very muscular, but some musculature is visible. Silver-gray hair and eyes, dark violet skin. Sleek facial structure and strong features.
bio.personalityTrait1: Quiet, but defensive. Vocal about expressing doubts and cautions, little else.
bio.personalityTrait2: Apologetic, quick to make amends, but only when I believe I have truly wronged a person. To those I kill, I sometimes send anonymous letters apologizing to the families. I never forgive myself.
bio.goal: Making amends is impossible. I must find some way back into my past to undo what I have done.
bio.fear: That I'll never find acceptance for what I've done.
bio.friend: Given my unique circumstances, friends aren't exactly commonplace in my life. Mrithun is my trusted contact with the Silence, a international group of anonymous pushers and movers. I care not what their motives are and I serve them only as a means to gather coin. Killing is one of the only things I am intimate with, so it is a perfect fit. I met Mrithun in an inn not long after I made the voyage from my homeland in Scasal. He approached me, noticing that I appeared foreign. He took advantage of my need for coin in a new and unforgiving place, but over time, I learned that he is a reliable source of information. After proving myself worthy, Mrithun rewarded me handsomely. Presently, Mrithun and I speak only when I am low on coin. Although our friendship is based almost purely on business and happenstance, I do still think of Mrithun as my friend.
bio.enemy: Myself. I can't forgive myself for what I've done and I can't forget it neither. There are times in combat where I am haunted by visions of my sin. In those moments I fight just as much with myself as I do with my opponents.
bio.otherCharacter: Vairen, a female human from Grunhijar, still writes to me even to this day. When I first arrived, I had traveled to her village and found her in the tundra nearby. She had been attacked by wolves and nearly died. She invited me into her home and provided for me for a few months before I had gathered enough coin to voyage. Whenever I move to a new area, I am always sure to write her so that she knows where to send her messages.
bio.organization: I am a lowly killer for hire for the Silence, an international network of anonymous pushers and movers. In the beginning the targets were always heavily armed, dangerous men. Once they realized that I was willing to get my hands dirty, the targets became softer, but the coin heftier. I made my choice.
bio.goodMemory: I remember the first day my father took me and my brother out to spar when we were only ten years of age. My brother had always been a more apt fighter.
bio.badMemory: The night I killed my brother plays in my head as the last thing I see when I struggle to dream every dusk. Every dawn the sight of his face is the first agonizing reminder of my sin.
bio.hobbies: I like to sketch out landscapes and wildlife, but parchment is expensive.
bio.socialStyle: I am deceptive and tactful. I try to use what others have said against them to give myself leverage in a debate. However, in a casual environment, I am naturally quiet and reserved. In large groups, I feel awkward, I don't like being the center of attention. As a result, it is mentally exhausting for me to keep up a social charade. I find common-talk to be useless and boring. I speak only with purpose. I understand the necessity of subtlety in order to accomplish certain goals and so I accept diplomacy as a useful tool, nothing more. I treat my allies cordially and as a means to my ultimate goal. I'm not here to make friends.
bio.combatStyle: I fight ruthlessly and with extreme precision. Whereas your average warrior is trained in fortitude, resilience, and stamina, a mercenary such as myself is trained in misdirection, accuracy, and dexterity. I typically research my targets well in advance of killing them, which gives me an edge in preparation. When I am caught off guard, I use my years of experience and intuition to overcome the odds. When I have to defend myself, I try to use my opponent's recklessness against them. I utilize the momentum of my aggressor's force to redirect blows into an advantageous position for myself. I fight so bravely not because I am truly courageous, but because, deep down, I accept death as punishment for my sin. I disregard my own injuries and the injuries of others in combat. My only focus when fighting is the elimination of my targets.
bio.equipment: Travelers clothes (shirt, pants, undergarments), dark leather cuirass, dark leather leggings, dark leather boots, dark leather bracers, fine finger-less gloves, Elderwood sheath, dark leather belt, water-skin, assortment of leather pouches, knapsack, bedroll, elvish two-handed curved sword, looking glass, a set of silverware utensils, a set of throwing knives, a set of poisons, a set of blade oils, a weapon cleaning and maintenance kit, a small leather-bound notebook half filled with sketches, a pencil, an elvish dagger, a yew longbow, arrows, a set of wood-carving knives, a hatchet, a reasonable amount of coin for a highly skilled assassin.

features.name: Brotherly Hauntings (Flaw)
features.description: When you kill a creature, make a DC 10 Wisdom roll. If you fail, you become stunned from dark memories. You can only take two actions each turn. You can spend one action each turn to make a DC 15 wisdom roll. If you succeed, you shake off the effects.

features.name: Misdirection
features.description: As a skill action, make an empowered agility roll against the perception of a creature within 20ft. If you succeed, you have advantage on the next attack against that creature.

features.name: Precise Attack
features.description: When you attack a creature with advantage, you can empower the attack roll. If you hit, it is a critical hit.

features.name: Stealth Tactics
features.description: Roll an additional damage die when you hit a creature that cannot see you with an attack.

features.name: Furtive
features.description: You can empower stealth rolls against creatures that you can see.

features.name: Apologetic
features.description: You have advantage on insight, synergy, and persuasion rolls involving creatures that you have damaged in the last 24 hours.

features.name: Forked Tongue
features.description: You can empower persuasion rolls that involve a lie.

features.name: Reversal of Might
features.description: When a creature attacks you using brawn and misses, you can use your reaction to expend a power die to apply a wrestling maneuver to that creature. Boosted: You can then make a melee attack against that creature.

features.name: Trained Hunter
features.description: When you succeed on an investigation roll against a creature, you gain advantage on your next attack roll against that creature, within 24 hours.

features.name: Battle Intuition
features.description: You can empower agility rolls to avoid attacks if you have not acted in combat yet.

features.name: No Escape
features.description: When a creature moves out of a space within your reach, you can expend a power die to take the wrestle action as a reaction, adding the result to the athletics roll.

features.name: Infiltrator
features.description: You can empower handiwork rolls to pick locks.

features.name: Reject Failure
features.description: When you have disadvantage on a roll because of another creature's action or feature, you can use your reaction to expend a power die to remove that disadvantage. Boosted: You cannot gain disadvantage from that action or feature from that creature for 1 minute.

features.name: You're Next
features.description: When you kill a creature, you gain advantage on the next Frighten action you take this turn.

features.name: Fey Lineage
features.description: You have advantage on willpower rolls to avoid being charmed or put to sleep.

features.name: Wasteland Survivor
features.description: You have advantage on investigation checks to find food in arctic, desert, underground, and other extreme environments.

bio.name: Ido Tomei
bio.highConcept: Renegade Assassin. Trained to kill for the state he now refuses to serve any unjust cause.
bio.flaw: Struggles with remnants of ruthless conditioning.
bio.description: Shaggy shoulder length black hair, green eyes. A long, torn grey cloak conceals his daggers and stolen shadowbox.
bio.personalityTrait1: Very friendly and open with people in lower classes
bio.personalityTrait2: Almost always keeps his hands in his cloak.
bio.alignment: Neutral Independant. He follows his own path. While he enjoys being with other people he will not let their beliefs override his own.
bio.goal: His dream is to destroy the political structure of the Estarian Santuary, but he doesn't see it as reasonable, so he doesn't particularly work towards it. He is driven day to day by a desire to help the less fortunate in the way that only he can.
bio.fear: To be captured and compelled to resume his past work.
bio.friend: Gianno Pettinato owns a tavern Ido frequents and connects Ido with people who may need his help.
bio.enemy: Sinesio Cosma was a rival member of the Cotellombra who needs no conditioning to enjoy his work. If he knew Ido was alive he would try to kill him.
bio.otherContact: Betta Verdi. An acolyte he left live after he killed the priest.
bio.organization: The Cotellombra is an assassin organization run by Patrons in the Estarian Sanctuary. They are conditioned through the use of psychology, drugs, and magic to be apathetic, ruthlessn, and loyal. Their skills as assassins are augmented by some powers over light and shadow. Ido broke his conditioning and escaped with a stolen shadowbox, the device members use to give them their powers.
bio.goodMemory: The culmination of his plans to leave to Cotellombra after breaking conditioning. He was able to escape with a shadowbox and fake his own death.
bio.badMemory: The assassination of a priest who was organizing peasants. As he died he was able to restore Ido's sense of self so Ido was left with his entire worldview broken realizing he had killed a good man.
bio.profession: He kills people to make life easier for peasants and lives off of the general goodwill he receives for doing this.
bio.hobbies: Mostly spends his time experimenting with and trying to understand the shadowbox.
bio.socialStyle: Enjoys company of lower class. Uncomfortable socializing with members of organizations or the wealthy.
bio.combatStyle: Uses stealth, shadows, surprise, and his knives.

equipment.name: Light Melee Weapons
equipment.description: Light melee weapons, including daggers, light axes, and brass knuckles, attack with an Athletics roll and deal d6 + Athletics damage on a hit. These weapons can also be used for two-weapon fighting.

equipment.name: Light Thrown Weapons
equipment.description: Light thrown weapons, including daggers and throwing axes, attack with an Athletics roll and deal d6 + Athletics damage on a hit. They can attack targets up to 20ft away or up to 40ft away with disadvantage.  These weapons can also be used for two-weapon fighting.

equipment.name: Divine Focuses
equipment.description: Divine weapons attack with a Wisdom. One-handed divine weapons deal d4 + Wisdom damage on a hit, and two-handed divine weapons deal d8 + Wisdom damage on a hit. This damage is mental and ignores armor. These weapons can attack targets up to 40ft away.

features.name: Ruthless Conditioning
features.description: If you attack a creature, you become Ruthless. While Ruthless, if there is a creature on another side within sight, you must succeed on a DC 10 Willpower roll or you must take the attack action this turn.

features.name: Shadow Step
features.description: As an empowered action, you place your shadowbox against a shadow to teleport to another shadow you can see. If you take an attack this turn after using Shadow Step, you can add the power dice result to your attack roll.

features.name: Stealth Tactics
features.description: Roll two damage dice when you hit a creature that cannot see you with a melee attack.

features.name: Revenge against the Wealthy
features.description: You can empower investigation rolls to determine information about a person's wealth, political position, connections, plans, secrets, and similar information.

features.name: Furtive
features.description: You can empower stealth rolls against creatures that you can see.

features.name: Trained Hunter
features.description: When you succeed on an investigation roll against a creature, you gain advantage on your next attack roll against that creature, within 24 hours.

features.name: Improviser
features.description: As a human, you are adept at handling situations when you are out of your depth. You can empower rolls that you have disadvantage on.

features.name: Fearless
features.description: As a human, you don't let any challenges get in the way of your goals. You can empower willpower rolls to resist or end the Frightened condition.

features.name: Quick Learner
features.description: As an Estarian, you easily pick up understanding of unusual magic and technology. You can empower knowledge rolls to identify magic and technology, including as part of the Identify reaction.

features.name: Risk-taker
features.description: As an Estarian, you are so used to taking incredible risks that you brush off the consequences. When you roll a natural 1, you can expend a power die to treat it as a natural 2 instead. Boosted: You can reroll the natural 1, using the new result instead.

features.name: Streetwise
features.description: You can empower social rolls involving people who live in a poor district of a city.

bio.name: Kyra
bio.highConcept: Wild Assassin who wants to fight but not kill
bio.description: I wear tight-fitting black leather clothing. Attached surgically to my spinal cord is a metal casing, from which extend two robotic arms.  I have a face that would be pretty if you don't mind the surgical enhancements and unnatural modifications. I keep my silvery hair short.
bio.personalityTrait2: I enjoy playing with my friends, but even more so playing with my victims.
bio.ideal: Perfecting my might is the only thing that matters.
bio.alignment: Chaotic Neutral. I do whatever comes to my mind first. I've only recently started working with others, and so far it seems somewhat beneficial.
bio.goal: Fight something I can’t beat, then learn to beat it.
bio.fear: Finding a limit to my power.
bio.friend: Dr. Niel performed all my augmentations, and I am always excited to see his newest inventions.
bio.enemy: Tony Fettucini is the bane of my existence, but also my greatest opportunity to learn.
bio.otherContact: Angel and I have a strange relationship, but I trust her more than anyone.
bio.organization: The Sage Council provides me with targets for assassination.
bio.goodMemory: Learning to use my metalimbs for the first time.
bio.socialStyle: I am aggressive, assertive, and often resort to violence. Torture is effective at getting me what I want, and enjoy pushing people’s buttons.
bio.combatStyle: I strike hard and quick. My four blades deal swift blows. However, when I can restrain myself, I avoid killing my victims so I can fight them again later.
bio.equipment: Four vibro swords, cigarettes, rocket launcher

equipment.name: Light Armor
equipment.description: Light armor provides 1 point of damage reduction and has no stealth penalty.

equipment.name: Light Melee Weapons
equipment.description: Light melee weapons, including daggers, light axes, and brass knuckles, attack with an Athletics roll and deal d6 + Athletics damage on a hit. These weapons can also be used for two-weapon fighting.

equipment.name: Heavy Loading Weapons
equipment.description: Heavy Loading weapons, including heavy crossbows and sniper rifles, attack with a Perception roll and deal d12 + Perception damage on a hit. They can attack targets up to 100ft away or up to 200ft away with disadvantage.

equipment.name: Small Shields
equipment.description: Small shields provide a +1 bonus to agility when raised and have no speed penalty while equipped.

equipment.name: Light Thrown Weapons
equipment.description: Light thrown weapons, including daggers and throwing axes, attack with an Athletics roll and deal d6 + Athletics damage on a hit. They can attack targets up to 20ft away or up to 40ft away with disadvantage.  These weapons can also be used for two-weapon fighting.

equipment.name: Light Loading Weapons
equipment.description: Light loading weapons, including hand crossbows and pistols, attack with a Perception roll and deal d8 + Perception damage on a hit. They can attack targets up to 40ft away or up to 80ft away with disadvantage. These weapons can also be used for two-weapon fighting.

features.name: Meta-Limbs
features.description: You can expend a power die. For a number of rounds equal to the result, when you take the off-hand attack action, you can attack with two additional light weapons held in your meta limbs. In addition, you can empower athletics, handiwork, and brawn rolls, except attack rolls.

features.name: Telekinesis
features.description: As a cardinal action, you can make an empowered wisdom roll against a creature’s fortitude. On a success, you can move them up to 40ft in any direction. If they impact a solid surface, they take 2d6 damage.

features.name: Frenzy
features.description: As a reaction when you take damage, you can expend a power die to gain armor equal to the result. You can spend your reaction whenever you take damage to maintain the armor. The frenzy ends if you start a turn without having taken this reaction since your last turn or end a turn without making an attack.

features.name: Acid Glands
features.description: As a cardinal action, make an empowered fortitude roll against the fortitude or agility of all creatures in a 60ft cone in front of you. Creatures take 2d6 damage and their armor is reduced by 1 point until they take downtime on a failure, or half as much damage and no other effect on a success.

features.name: Immoral (Flaw)
features.description: You have no sense of moral direction. When you must make a decision, or the DM calls for a self-control roll, roll DC 15 willpower. If you fail, you must take the option that is most immediately beneficial to Kyra, no matter the consequences.

features.name: Advanced Imager
features.description: As a basic action, you can activate or deactivate infrared vision. While active, you have disadvantage on investigation, insight, and defense rolls, but you can see heat signatures through darkness and solid objects.

features.name: Reflex Boosters
features.description: As a basic action, you can expend a power die. For a number of rounds equal to the result, you gain +1 quick.

features.name: Chemical Rebreather
features.description: You become immune to the effects of chemical toxins, poisons, smoke, and other irritants, and you automatically succeed on fortitude rolls to resist these effects.

features.name: Retinal HUD
features.description: As a basic action, you learn the current health and conditions of a creature within 40 feet. Also, you can empower the Identify reaction.

features.name: Hyper-Oxygenation
features.description: As a basic action, you can expend a power die. For a number of rounds equal to the result, you gain +5 movement speed, +1 agility, and 10 temporary HP.

features.name: Quick
features.description: Your movement speed increases by 5 feet.

bio.name: Nibbles T. McGibbles
bio.description: An old, grizzled gnome. He's thin and fairly tall for a gnome. He's always wearing aviator goggles. He's got a long white mullet and rat tail hairstyle, usually kept under a leather cap. He's relaxed and overall chill. He's usually wearing jeans and a jacket. Almost looks like a biker, but less buff and more gnome.
bio.goal: The removal of the Melndar family and installation of a peaceful government in Fessos.
bio.fear: All out war between Eldyus and Fessos
bio.friend: Grelee Gremoirin. Director of the Eldyan Research Commission and overseer of their Arcane Protection division. Nibbles serves under him as a close and mutual friend.
bio.enemy: Vathym Melndar, a very high ranking general in Fessos. Led the wyrmriders into the siege of Synymna. Nibbles fought them off in a lone airship.
bio.otherContact: Flickdale Baublespanner. An ill tempered gnome new to the Research Commission and stuck in a situation far above their paygrade.
bio.organization: A founding member of the Arcane Protection division of the ERC.
bio.goodMemory: Visiting the southern continent for the first time with Grelee and friends in the ERC
bio.badMemory: The deaths of most of his compatriots and friends back during the siege of Synymna
bio.hobbies: Airship tricks, card games, darts, whisky
bio.socialStyle: Mostly quiet if others are more vocal. Close and kind to allies, though prone to light teasing. Analytical and somewhat nervous when dealing with other organizations and powerful hostile forces.
bio.combatStyle: Generally pilots his ship. He's an expert who  pulls off reckless maneuvers to gain advantage in the fights. He tries his best to prevent his allies from being injured by keeping them out of harm's way and keeping his enemies on the business end of his cannons. He'll always go back for the injured, especially after the siege.

equipment.name: Air Vehicles
equipment.description: A proficiency in air vehicles allows you to pilot and control vehicles that fly through the sky, such as airships, balloons, and airplanes.

equipment.name: Two-handed Loading Weapons
equipment.description: Two-handed loading weapons, including light crossbows and rifles, attack with a Perception roll and deal d8 + Perception damage on a hit. They can attack targets up to 60ft away or up to 120ft away with disadvantage.

features.name: PTSD (Flaw)
features.description: When a creature dies within 5 feet of you, make a DC 10 willpower roll.  You have disadvantage if you killed the creature. On a success, you are immune to this effect until you take a rest. On a failure, you have disadvantage on rolls that target hostile creatures for 1 minute.

features.name: Magic Resistance
features.description: As a Gnome, you gain advantage on willpower rolls to resist spells and magical effects.

features.name: Natural Illusionist
features.description: As a gnome, you have a natural talent for creating small illusions to tease and trick others. As a skill action, make a knowledge roll and record the result. You create an illusory object that is not bigger than 1 foot in any dimension and within 5 feet of you. A creature can use its action to make a perception or knowledge roll against your result to determine that the illusion is false. You can end the illusion at any time, but it cannot move or produce any sound.

features.name: Quick Learner
features.description: As an Eldyan, you easily pick up understanding of unusual magic and technology. You can empower knowledge rolls to identify magic and technology, including as part of the Identify reaction.

features.name: Diplomat
features.description: As an Eldyan, you find it easy to interact with people of other cultures easily. You can empower persuasion rolls to make a good first impression on someone not from Eldyus.

features.name: Daredevil
features.description: When you make a roll involving piloting a ship, including attack and defense rolls, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on your own roll and regain 1 spent power dice of your choice.  This power dice must be spend by the end of your next turn or it is lost.

features.name: Expert Pilot
features.description: You can empower handiwork rolls involving piloting an airship.

features.name: Trigger Finger
features.description: When a creature declares an attack before you have acted in combat, you can use your reaction to make an empowered attack against that creature with a loading weapon.

features.name: Defender
features.description: You can easily spot attacks coming at your allies and warn them. When a creature attacks an ally within 40 feet of you, you can use your reaction to empower the ally's defense roll. If the ally succeeds in defending, they can then use their reaction to take a Move action.

features.name: Gut Instinct
features.description: Your talents in combat have been sharpened to a fine edge. Between each of your turns, you can take a number of reactions equal to your smart score.

features.name: Spot the Weakness
features.description: As a skill action, roll perception against a the stealth of a creature within 20 feet. On success, you can add your perception bonus to the next attack against that creature by someone other than you.

bio.name: Purse Full of Coin
bio.highConcept: Animal lover whose spirits cast spells for him
bio.flaw: People are annoying. Also trading is bad.
bio.description: Coin has deep black fur, long claws, and ruffled hair. His young feline face contains piercing catlike eyes and a wicked grin. His clothing appears to be a fine shirt that has been ripped into long shreds and wrapped around his chest. He wears extravagant trousers with patchy holes and a short cape attached at the waist. Several chunks of thick wood are attached on his shoulders and wrists as a sort of armor, but he appears to carry no weapons. His feet are bare and around his neck is a necklace made of hawk feathers, bear claws, and a single, broken unicorn horn.
bio.personalityTrait1: I often unexpectedly change my mood or my mind in an instant.
bio.personalityTrait2: I act much younger than my age.
bio.ideal: Discovery. I want to uncover all the secrets of the natural world, and possibly find a way back to the Feywild.
bio.alignment: Chaotic Independent. I do my best to avoid people and love going on new adventures and experiencing new things.
bio.goal: Find a way back into the Feywild and never return.
bio.fear: My father will find me and punish me for what I have done.
bio.friend: Teerbil. Supposedly he spent years with me in the Feywild, and he has been nice to me so far.
bio.enemy: Boom of Thunder, my father, was abusive and greedy. He expected me to be more like him.
bio.otherContact: My old troupe is still out there, including Hetak, the necromancer who tortured my best friends, the animals in the troupe.
bio.organization: The Rising Dune Clan is a clan of tabaxi that I am descended from. I have never met them, but I would like to.
bio.goodMemory: I once had an amazing performance with Solstice, Turska, and Baron that was the largest crowd I ever performed acrobatics with. We blew them away.
bio.badMemory: I discovered that Hetak was a necromancer that, under orders from my father, had been killing and resurrecting my animal friends repeatedly to avoid costs for food and medicine.
bio.hobbies: Playing my dolcimer, exploring the wilderness, training animals, and helping them however I can.
bio.socialStyle: People are greedy, cruel, and selfish, so they don't deserve any kindness. But I have to deal with them to take care of animals, so I'll deal with them as necessary.
bio.combatStyle: I'm really not much of a fighter. I've learned a trick where I can throw enchanted coins at people, but when things get tough, I have to rely on the unicorn Solstice, the bear Turska, and the eagle Baron to protect myself. These animal spirits channel power through me to perform amazing deeds.
bio.equipment: My performer's outfit has been torn to pieces from years of travel through the wilderness, but I haven't bothered finding better clothes. I wear several chunks of wood strapped to my body as armor, and I have a necklace made with hawk feathers, bear claws, and a single, broken unicorn horn.

equipment.name: Unarmed Fighting
equipment.description: Unarmed melee weapons, including fists, feet, and tails, can attack with a Brawn roll or an Athletics roll and deal d6 + Athletics or Brawn damage on a hit. These weapons can also be used for two-weapon fighting.

equipment.name: Light Thrown Weapons
equipment.description: Light thrown weapons, including daggers and throwing axes, attack with an Athletics roll and deal d6 + Athletics damage on a hit. They can attack targets up to 20ft away or up to 40ft away with disadvantage.  These weapons can also be used for two-weapon fighting.

equipment.name: Light Armor
equipment.description: Light armor provides 1 point of damage reduction and has no stealth penalty.

features.name: Hatred of Civilization (Flaw)
features.description: You avoid people and hate money. When someone offers you a trade involving objects, or you wish to offer such a trade, make a DC 10 wisdom roll. On a failure, you cannot do that trade.

features.name: Spirit Totem
features.description: You call upon one of your spirits for aid. As a cardinal action, expend a power die to summon a bear, eagle, or unicorn totem within 20 feet for a number of rounds equal to the power die result. You can use a basic action to move the totem. A creature within 20 feet of a bear totem gains 1 armor. A creature within 20 feet of a unicorn totem heals 3 hit points each turn. A creature within 20 feet of an eagle totem gains +2 to each of its attack rolls.

features.name: Animal Friend
features.description: You have advantage on social rolls involving animals.

features.name: Animal Possession
features.description: As a cardinal action, expend a power die and take the form of a bear, unicorn, or eagle. The form has hit points equal to twice the power die results. When these hit points are reduced to 0, you revert to your original form and take the remaining damage.

features.name: Traveler
features.description: You are accustomed to a life on the road. You can empower rolls made during travel that lasts a day or more.

features.name: Sudden Dash
features.description: As a tabaxi, when you take the move action, you can double your speed until the end of this turn. If you do, you cannot use this ability again until you take a rest.

features.name: Feline Awareness
features.description: You can empower perception rolls that rely on smell.

features.name: Acrobat
features.description: Crossing high wires and tumbling through the air are daily jobs for you. You have advantage on agility and athletics rolls to avoid falling or losing your balance.

features.name: Conjure Animals
features.description: As a cardinal action, expend a power die. You summon animal spirits of the DM's choice within 20 feet of you for 1 hour. The sum of their power levels must be less than or equal to the power die result. They are on your side and obey your commands.

features.name: Blessing of the Unicorn
features.description: As a basic action, touch a creature and expend a power. The creature recovers a number of hit points equal to the power die result.

features.name: Ferocity of the Bear
features.description: You can empower intimidation rolls.

bio.name: Vicostra Vramiir
bio.highConcept: Illusionist Spy who Cannot Stand Dissatisfaction
bio.faith: Minor devotion to Vuhdea, goddess of Joy and Pleasure
bio.description: Dark grey skin, long, beautiful white hair, piercing grey eyes, ornate armor with hi-low dress
bio.personalityTrait1: I collect and spread rumors and gossip wherever I go.
bio.personalityTrait2: I need to be surrounded by the rich and beautiful.
bio.ideal: Illusory Joy. I’ll do whatever it takes to make people think that everything is as they want.
bio.alignment: Neutral Social. I find meaning in my interactions with others, and I have little concern for order or freedom, as long as everyone is happy.
bio.goal: Rebuild my reputation as a wealthy, benevolent aristocrat.
bio.fear: My lies get me into a place full of suffering, such as prison or war, where I have to constantly see people upset.
bio.friend: A drug dealer who grew up on the streets with me.
bio.enemy: A former lover who killed my mentor
bio.otherContact: Mother still works as a servant
bio.organization: House Perla is my next shot at success.
bio.goodMemory: An upper-class woman adopted me and taught me how to navigate the complex social society of the wealthiest people in Ushal
bio.badMemory: A former lover killed my mentor and wants me to suffer after I lied to him.
bio.profession: Ushallin Prince cons, then sponsorship by wealthy woman
bio.socialStyle: I try to figure out what people want to hear, then tell them exactly that. I’ll use illusion and enchantment magic to back up my claims if necessary. My deceptions often go very deep, but I make sure to be far away when they get figured out.
bio.combatStyle: I use my magic to distract and confuse enemies, and try to convince them that I am not worth fighting. But if that doesn’t work, I am quite skilled with the rapier and hand crossbow. I also utilize a variety of potions.
bio.equipment: Fake drow armor, rapier, violin, poison vials, fake letters from a fake drow house, a necklace from my dead mentor

features.name: Forked Tongue
features.description: You can empower persuasion rolls that include a lie.

features.name: Minor Illusion
features.description: As a skill action, you make an empowered knowledge roll and record the result. You create an illusory object no bigger than a 10ft cube, within the range of your focus for one minute. A creature can use its action to make a perception or knowledge roll against your result to determine that the illusion is false. You can end the illusion at any time, but it cannot move or produce any sound.

features.name: Magic Disguise

requirements.item: A piece of clothing that has been worn by someone else

features.description: As a cardinal action, you make an empowered synergy roll and record the result. For one hour, you appear to be the last creature that has worn the reagent besides yourself. A creature can use its action to make a perception or knowledge roll against your result to determine that the illusion is false. For the duration, you can use a basic action to disable or enable the illusion. It must be the same creature for each casting of the spell.

features.name: Memory Theft
features.description: As an empowered reaction when a creature dies within the range of your focus, you can capture some of its memories. You ask the DM one question, and if the creature knew the answer to that question, the DM reveals it to you. Boosted: You may ask up to three questions.

features.name: Pathological Liar
features.description: When a creature correctly claims that you lied to them, or a creature correctly claims that you created an illusion, you have disadvantage on social rolls involving this person for 1 day, unless you convince them otherwise.

features.name: Suggestion
features.description: As a cardinal action, you make an empowered synergy roll against the willpower of a creature within the range of your focus. If you succeed, the target pursues a course of action of your choice to the best of its ability. The target will not cause harm to itself, physically or otherwise, and the spell ends after 8 hours, when the target completes the action, or when you or any of your companions harms the target. If you fail the roll, the target realizes it was affected by magic.

features.name: Message
features.description: As a basic action, choose a creature within 120 ft. You must see it or know its approximate location. The target mentally receives a simple message from you and can mentally transmit a simple message back to you.

features.name: Terrifying Whispers
features.description: You can empower an attack with a unity focus. If you hit with that attack, the creature is frightened for 1 minute of you or another creature of your choice that both you and the target can see.

features.name: Mage Hand
features.description: As a basic action, you create a spectral hand within 30 feet of you. You can spend an action to have it use the Interact with Item, Move, or Wrestle actions. It has a speed of 10 feet and uses your synergy modifier for all of its rolls.

features.name: Darkness
features.description: As a cardinal empowered action, you create a 20 ft radius shadowy cloud within 120 ft of you for 1 minute. Creatures cannot see other creatures within the cloud, and creatures within the cloud cannot see. Boosted: You can see anything inside the cloud.

features.name: Invisibility
features.description: As an empowered action, you cannot be seen for 1 hour. If you perform any action that interacts with a creature or object other than yourself or an object you are holding, the spell ends. Boosted: The first time the spell would end because of an action you take, it does not end.

features.name: Jack of All Trades
features.description: When you roll a skill that you have a negative modifier in, you can expend a power die to treat your modifier as +0. Boosted: Treat the modifier as +1 instead.

features.name: Deceptive Reasoning
features.description: If a creature sees an illusion you create and does not realize that it is an illusion, you gain advantage on Persuasion rolls against that creature.

features.name: Fey Lineage
features.description: You can empower Willpower rolls to avoid being charmed or put to sleep.

features.name: Wasteland Survival
features.description: You can empower Investigation checks to find food in arctic, desert, and underground environments, and knowledge checks involving flora and fauna of these environments.
